result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle M Wanta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 8 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. Last 4 months with Huber.
Court allows for transfer to Marathon County.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with Christopher L.
Upon successful completion of the sentence without ANY violations Court will allow for expungement.

Provide a DNA sample. 
Only utilize one pharmacy.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens, no right of refusal.

timeConds.notes: stayed for use at the discretion of the probation agent.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Expungement, received and filed.

Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the defendant's motion for expungement filed on 1/17/18 is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag
Letter to defense counsel
Defendant's notice of motion and motion for expungement.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 8 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Last 4 months with Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  Court allows for transfer to Marathon County.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days condition time stayed for use at the discretion of the probation agent.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens, no right of refusal.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Christopher L.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Only utilize one pharmacy.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
 Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Upon successful completion of the sentence without ANY violations Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Kyle M Wanta in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 08/17/2015 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
